card_answer:
###Advice is an opinion about what to do.

---

_I don’t know how to study for my exams. Can you give me some advice?_

###Along means down the length of a road, river, etc.

---

_Walk along this tunnel for ten minutes, and you’ll see a door on the left._

###Attention is the notice, thought, or consideration of someone.

---

_His work got the attention of two of his co-workers._

###To attract means to make a person or thing come closer or be interested.

---

_The magnet attracted the metal._

###To climb means to use your hands and feet to go up something.

---

_The girls climbed to the top of the mountain._

###To drop is to fall or allow something to fall.

---

_A small amount of water dropped from the bottle._

###If something is final, it is the last part.

---

_In the final part of the film, the man and the woman got married._

###Further means at or from a greater distance or time.

---

_The escalator is further than I thought._

###To imply something is to suggest it without saying it.

---

_The man implied that he wanted the job, but he didn’t say so._

###To maintain means to make something stay the same.

---

_The balls maintain constant movement._

###You use neither to connect two negative possibilities.

---

_Neither the path on the left nor the path on the right will lead us home._

###Otherwise means in another way if you don’t do this.

---

_It’s good to stay active; otherwise, you’ll gain weight._

###If something is physical, it is related to your body and not your mind.

---

_Biking is good for your physical health._

###To prove something is to show that it is true.

---

_My teacher proved the answer on the board._

###To react is to respond by acting in a certain way.

---

_James reacted badly to the news._

###To ride something is to travel on it. You can ride an animal, a bike, etc.

---

_I will ride a roller coaster for the first time today._

###If something is situated somewhere, it is in that place.

---

_The whiteboard is situated between the two men._

###Society is a group of people who interact and share a culture.

---

_Society expects people to be good and honest._

###A standard is what people consider normal or good.

---

_This older model TV is below our store’s standards._

###To suggest something means to give an idea or plan about it.

---

_He suggested that we go to see his boss._

###Actually means in fact or really.

---

_My dad looks a little mean, but actually he’s very kind._

###Bite is the act of using your teeth to cut and tear into something.

---

_The boy took a big bite of his hamburger._

###The coast is the land by an ocean.

---

_I stayed on the southern coast of Australia._

###A deal is an agreement that you have with another person.

---

_I made a deal with the other company to give us some money._

###The desert is an area of land without many plants or water.

---

_Not many plants grow in the desert._

###If something is effective, it works well.

---

_Swimming is an effective way to stay healthy._

###To examine something is to look at it carefully.

---

_The doctor examined my eyes today._

###If something is false, it is not correct.

---

_If you think the answer is false, press the red button._

###When you figure something out, you come to understand it and find an answer.

---

_I couldn’t figure out what he wanted me to do._

###A gift is something you give someone.

---

_Dave received many gifts for Christmas._

###Hunger is the feeling that you get when you need to eat.

---

_After playing all day long, he was filled with hunger._

###To imagine something is to think of it in your mind.

---

_Sally imagined herself winning lots of money._

###A journey is a long trip.

---

_I went on a journey across the country with my parents._

###A puzzle is something that is hard to understand.

---

_The question was a puzzle to him._

###Quite means that something is a certain way completely or very much.

---

_I think typing on a keyboard is quite easy._

###Rather is used when you want to do one thing but not the other.

---

_I would rather have the red one than the blue one._

###If something is specific, it is precise or exact.

---

_Please choose a specific place on the map._

###A spider is a small creature with eight legs.

---

_Some adults have a fear of little creatures such as spiders._

###A tour is a short trip in which you see many sights.

---

_I took a tour of Asia and Europe._

###A trip is a journey to a certain place.

---

_Ken took a trip to the city yesterday._

###A band is a group of people who play music.

---

_My brother is in a rock band._

###Barely means by the smallest amount, almost not.

---

_I barely had enough money to pay for my bus ticket._

###If something is boring, it is not fun.

---

_I think the Internet is boring._

###To cancel means to decide that an event or a request will not happen.

---

_She canceled the rest of her plans because of the rain._

###A driveway is a short private road that leads to a person’s home.

---

_The long driveway led us to their new house._

###Garbage is waste material like unwanted or spoiled food, bottles, paper, etc.

---

_The boy cleaned up the garbage around his house._

###An instrument is something designed to do a certain task like play music.

---

_My favorite musical instrument is the piano._

###A list is a record of information printed with an item on each line.

---

_My mom makes a list of groceries to buy._

###Magic is the power to do impossible things.

---

_The magician used magic to pull a rabbit out of his hat._

###A message is a set of words that you send to someone.

---

_I left a message for you in the envelope._

###To notice something is to see it for the first time.

---

_Did you notice the view?_

###To own something means to have it. That thing belongs to you.

---

_My grandfather owns that house._

###To predict something is to say that it will happen.

---

_She predicted that I would get married next year._

###A professor is a person who teaches in college.

---

_Mike’s science professor knows a lot about physics._

###To rush is to go somewhere or do something very quickly.

---

_Nancy rushed to finish her homework._

###A schedule is a plan that tells you when to do things.

---

_What is your class schedule for today?_

###To share something is to give some of it to another person.

---

_Jimmy shared his apple with me._

###A stage is a place where actors or musicians act or sing.

---

_A large screen was on the stage._

###A storm is very bad weather. There is a lot of rain or snow.

---

_Did that storm wake you up last night?_

###You use within to say that something is inside another thing.

---

_Within the box, there was a pizza._

###A burden is a serious or difficult responsibility.

---

_Children who do not behave are a burden to their parents._

###To compromise is to agree to something that is not exactly what you want.

---

_We both compromised about the game we decided to play._

###To craft something is to make it using skill.

---

_She crafted the bookcase out of solid pine wood and then painted it._

###When you dive into water, you go down head first into the water.

---

_I like sky-diving from an airplane._

###When people or things are fragile, they are not strong and can be damaged easily.

---

_The fragile glassware was carefully packed into boxes._

###If you cut something into two parts that are the same size, you cut it half.

---

_The machine can divide the book in half._

###Innocence is a lack of experience of difficult or complex things in life.

---

_Everyone who met her found her innocence to be charming._

###When you lead something, you go first and it follows you.

---

_I will lead you to the right place._

###When you have a meeting, you are with other people.

---

_We have lots of meetings at our school to plan what to do._

###To merge two things is to combine them into one whole thing.

---

_The storm clouds merged into one large menacing cloud that filled the sky._

###When something is moderate, it is not too big or too small in size or amount.

---

_It takes a moderate amount of patience to be around small children all day._

###To overwhelm is to exist in such a large amount that someone cannot deal with it.

---

_The amount of homework her teacher assigned has overwhelmed her._

###When you make a payment, you give someone some money for what you get.

---

_I made the last payment on my car yesterday. Now I am really the owner._

###A perception of a situation is a way of thinking about it or understanding it.

---

_Since he couldn’t see, his perception of life was much different than mine._

###When you settle something, you reach an agreement.

---

_We settled the argument by looking up the answer on the web._

###A shiver is a shaking movement the body makes when someone is cold or scared.

---

_I got shivers on my way home because it was so cold._

###When someone is sociable, they are friendly.

---

_Many of my good friends are sociable, but I am shy._

###When you speed, you go very fast.

---

_Speeding is the cause of most car accidents._

###When someone is talkative, he or she talks a lot.

---

_My aunt is very talkative whenever she is on the phone._

###When something is usual, it is what we expect.

---

_It was just the usual people who came._

###If something is above, it is at a higher level than something else.

---

_He straightened the sign that was above the crowd._

###If something is ahead of something else, it is in front of it.

---

_The blue car drove on ahead of us._

###An amount is how much there is of something.

---

_Can I use my card to pay for the entire amount?_

###A belief is a strong feeling that something is correct or true.

---

_A preacher or priest should have a strong belief in God._

###The center of something is the middle of it.

---

_The center of a dart board is the most important spot._

###If something is common, it happens often or there is much of it.

---

_It is common for snow to fall in the winter._

###To cost is to require payment.

---

_These designer shoes cost more than the regular ones._

###To demonstrate something is to show how it is done.

---

_She demonstrated her plan to her co-workers._

###Different describes someone or something that is not the same as others.

---

_Each of my sisters has a different hair style._

###Evidence is a fact or thing that you use to prove something.

---

_He used the pictures as evidence that UFOs are real._

###Honesty means the quality of being truthful or honest.

---

_A courtroom should be a place of honesty._

###An idiom is a phrase with a meaning different from its words.

---

_The idiom “when pigs fly” means that something will never happen._

###If something is independent, it is not controlled by something else.

---

_She chose to live an independent life in the country._

###Inside means the inner part, space or side of something.

---

_The inside of the box was empty._

###A jail is a place to keep bad people.

---

_He was sent to jail for taking other people’s cars._

###A master is a person who is very good at something.

---

_My brother is a master of taekwondo._

###A memory is something you remember.

---

_The memory of my first time in the city will always be the best._

###A pocket is a part of your clothing where you can keep things.

---

_She always had her hands in her pockets._

###If something is proper, it is right.

---

_It is not proper to throw your garbage on the road._

###If something is for sale, you can buy it.

---

_Everything for sale here is the same price._
